subject: RE: [junit] assert returns void, i wish it didn't
msgSnippet: ... More accurately, assert*() either throws an Error or doesn t.  That s important to keep in mind if you re planning to catch, process, and potentially
messageBody:
> assert*() either throws an exception or doesn't.

More accurately, assert*() either throws an Error or doesn't. That's
important to keep in mind if you're planning to catch, process, and
potentially rethrow.

java.lang.Object
|
+--java.lang.Throwable
|
+--java.lang.Error
|
+--junit.framework.AssertionFailedError


Todd.
